net.sf.mmm.search.engine.base

Class AbstractSearchResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.search.engine.base.AbstractSearchResult
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SearchResult

    public abstract class AbstractSearchResult
extends Object
implements SearchResult
    This is the abstract base implementation of the SearchResult interface.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • getQuery

        public String getQuery()

      • getPageCount

        public int getPageCount()
        This method gets the number of pages used to split the total hits using the default number of hits per page. An empty search result will have one empty page.
        Specified by:
        getPageCount in interface SearchResult
        Returns:
        the number of pages.
        See Also:
        SearchResult.getPageCount(int)

      • getPageCount

        public int getPageCount(int hitsPerPage)
        This method gets number of pages used to split the total hits using the given hitsPerPage. An empty search result will have one empty page.
        Specified by:
        getPageCount in interface SearchResult
        Parameters:
        hitsPerPage - is the desired number of hits per page. This should be a value like 5, 10, 20, 30, ..., 100.
        Returns:
        the number of pages required to split the total hits.

      • getPage

        public SearchResultPage getPage(int pageIndex)
        This method gets the page of this search-result at the given pageIndex using the default number of hits per page.
        Specified by:
        getPage in interface SearchResult
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - is the page index of the requested search result. This should be in the range from 0 to SearchResult.getPageCount() - 1.
        It can NOT be guaranteed that the pageIndex is always valid in the sense as described above (the search index may have been modified in the meantime). An implementation has to be able to handle calls with a pageIndex greater or equal to SearchResultPage.getPageCount(). The recommended strategy is to return the last page in this case.
        Returns:
        the requested page.
        See Also:
        SearchEngine.search(SearchQuery, int)

      • getPage

        public SearchResultPage getPage(int pageIndex,
                                int hitsPerPage)
        This method gets the page of this search-result at the given pageIndex using the given hitsPerPage. This method is a simple implementation of this method. Please override if there is a more efficient way to do this.
        Specified by:
        getPage in interface SearchResult
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - is the page index of the requested search result. This should be in the range from 0 to getPageCount(hitsPerPage) - 1 .
        It can NOT be guaranteed that the pageIndex is always valid in the sense as described above (the search index may have been modified in the meantime). An implementation has to be able to handle calls with a pageIndex greater or equal to SearchResultPage.getPageCount(). The recommended strategy is to return the last page in this case.
        hitsPerPage - is the number of hits contained in a SearchResultPage.
        Returns:
        the requested page.
        See Also:
        SearchEngine.search(SearchQuery, int)
